conclusion: Need to analyze the velocity-time graph to determine acceleration direction.
The graph shows the skydiver's vertical velocity over time; from 0 to 10 seconds, the velocity increases.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time.
If the velocity is increasing, the acceleration is positive; if decreasing, the acceleration is negative.
The slope of the velocity-time graph represents the acceleration.
A positive slope indicates positive acceleration; a negative slope indicates negative acceleration.
From 0 to 10 seconds, the velocity is increasing, so the slope is positive.
The acceleration is positive during the 0 to 10 seconds interval.
Positive acceleration means the direction of acceleration is in the same direction as the velocity.
Since the skydiver is moving downward, the acceleration is also downward.
